module.name: StdCtrls
module.short: Several standard controls used in most Lazarus forms

element.name: TEditCharCase
element.short: The case of text displayed in an edit box or combobox.

element.name: TEditCharCase.ecNormal
element.short: Normal mode - no conversion.

element.name: TEditCharCase.ecUppercase
element.short: Converts every entered character to upper case.

element.name: TEditCharCase.ecLowerCase
element.short: Converts every entered character to lower case.

element.name: TEchoMode
element.short: How text in the edit box is displayed.

element.name: TEchoMode.emNormal
element.short: Characters are shown unmodified.

element.name: TEchoMode.emNone
element.short: All characters shown as spaces.

element.name: TEchoMode.emPassword
element.short: All characters shown as PasswordChar.

element.name: TScrollStyle
element.short: The appearance of scroll bars on a control.

element.name: TScrollStyle.ssNone
element.short: No scrollbars.

element.name: TScrollStyle.ssHorizontal
element.short: A horizontal scrollbar is shown.

element.name: TScrollStyle.ssVertical
element.short: A vertical scrollbar is shown.

element.name: TScrollStyle.ssBoth
element.short: Both horizontal and vertical scrollbars are shown.

element.name: TScrollStyle.ssAutoHorizontal
element.short: A horizontal scrollbar is shown when needed.

element.name: TScrollStyle.ssAutoVertical
element.short: A vertical scrollbar is shown when needed.

element.name: TScrollStyle.ssAutoBoth
element.short: Both scrollbars are shown as needed.

element.name: TScrollCode
element.short: The scroll action type, as reported by the widget.

descr.p: These values must correspond to the SB_xxx values in LCLType.

element.name: TScrollCode.scLineUp
element.short: Scroll one line up (column left).

element.name: TScrollCode.scLineDown
element.short: Scroll one line down (column right).

element.name: TScrollCode.scPageUp
element.short: Scroll one page up (left).

element.name: TScrollCode.scPageDown
element.short: Scroll one page down (right).

element.name: TScrollCode.scPosition
element.short: Scroll to the specified position.

element.name: TScrollCode.scTrack
element.short: Scroll tracking to the specified position.

element.name: TScrollCode.scTop
element.short: Scroll to the top (left) end.

element.name: TScrollCode.scBottom
element.short: Scroll to the bottom (right) end.

element.name: TScrollCode.scEndScroll
element.short: Scrolling finished.

element.name: TScrollEvent
element.short: Handler type for scrolling events.
element.descr: The handler is called before the new Position is set. It can adjust the new position, based on the parameters and the (old) scrollbar.Position.

element.name: TScrollEvent.Sender
element.short: The scrollbar

element.name: TScrollEvent.ScrollCode
element.short: The scroll action.

element.name: TScrollEvent.ScrollPos
element.short: The suggested new scroll position. Change this value to implement custom scroll behaviour.

element.name: TCustomScrollBar
element.short: The base class for TScrollBar.

element.name: TCustomScrollBar.CreateParams.Params
element.short: The parameter list.

element.name: TCustomScrollBar.CreateWnd
element.short: CreateWnd - calls inherited CreateWnd then initialises various Scroll Info properties

descr.p: The inherited method creates the interface object, sets parameters and assigns the handle
Then the size of scrollbar, maximum and minimum values, page size and position of scrollbar are set

element.name: TCustomScrollBar.Change
element.short: Invokes the OnChange handler.

element.name: TCustomScrollBar.Scroll
element.short: Invokes the OnScroll handler.

element.name: TCustomScrollBar.Scroll.ScrollCode
element.short: The code used for scrolling - up or down a line, a page, to the top or bottom etc

element.name: TCustomScrollBar.Scroll.ScrollPos
element.short: The position of the scrolling device

element.name: TCustomScrollBar.SetParams
element.short: Defines the Max and Min values, the size of the page and the position of the scroller

element.name: TCustomScrollBar.Kind
element.short: The scrollbar orientation, horizontal or vertical.

element.name: TCustomScrollBar.LargeChange
element.short: The distance to scroll on an click beneath the slider.

element.name: TCustomScrollBar.Max
element.short: The maximum value, for the bottom or rightmost position.

element.name: TCustomScrollBar.Min
element.short: The minimum value, for the top or leftmost position.

element.name: TCustomScrollBar.PageSize
element.short: The size of the slider, relative to the total scroll range.

element.name: TCustomScrollBar.Position
element.short: The position value of the slider in the ScrollBar.

element.name: TCustomScrollBar.SmallChange
element.short: The distance to scroll on an click on the up/down buttons.
element.descr: A small change occurs when the up or down buttons are clicked, or by up/down keyboard commands. It is typically used for scrolling by a few pixels, or by a single row or column of text.

element.name: TCustomScrollBar.OnChange
element.short: Event handler for any change of the Position.

element.name: TCustomScrollBar.OnScroll
element.short: Handler for a scrolling event by mouse, keyboard or code.

descr.p: The handler can override the new position, based on the scrolling parameters.

element.name: TScrollBar
element.short: A control that allows the user to scroll the content of an associated control by moving an slider.

descr.p: A control that allows the user to scroll the content of a window, by moving an slider.
It appears as a long rectangular track bar, within which a smaller contrasting block or slider can move up and down (or from side to side in a horizontal ScrollBar).

It has small triangular indicators or pointers on one or both ends of the bar, depending on the widgetset. Clicking with the mouse on one of the pointers moves the slider a small distance (SmallChange) in the specified direction.
Clicking with the mouse in the blank area of the scrollbar above or below the slider makes the slider move by a larger increment (LargeChange).
The slider can also be moved by clicking on it with the mouse, and holding down the button while moving the mouse. The slider then follows the mouse until the button is released.
If the mouse has a scrollwheel, the slider also can be moved by rotating the wheel.
The arrow keys or the Page Up/Page Down keys on the keyboard can be used to move the slider, too.

The location of the slider along the track is held in the Position property. It's the programmer's responsibility to ensure that the content of the window is scrolled to the new Position of the scrollbar.

element.name: TCustomGroupBox
element.short: The base class for TGroupBox, TRadioGroup and TCheckGroup.

element.name: TGroupBox
element.short: A container that allows a number of objects to be grouped physically and conceptually on a form.

descr.p: The objects can be moved around together and have certain properties in common.

element.name: TGroupBox.Caption
element.short: The text displayed in the border around the box.

element.name: TComboBoxAutoCompleteTextOption
element.short: Defines the behavior of the AutoComplete feature in a combobox control.

ul.li: cbactEnabled: Enable Auto-Completion feature.
cbactEndOfLineComplete: Perform Auto-Complete only when cursor is at the end of the string.
cbactRetainPrefixCase: Retains the case of characters user has typed. (This option has no effect if cbactEndOfLineComplete is False)
cbactSearchCaseSensitive: Search completion string with case sensitivity.
cbactSearchAscending: Search completion string in ascending order. (False will search in descending order)

element.name: TComboBoxAutoCompleteTextOption.cbactEnabled
element.short: Enable Auto-Completion feature.

element.name: TComboBoxAutoCompleteTextOption.cbactEndOfLineComplete
element.short: Perform Auto-Complete only when cursor is at the end of the string.

element.name: TComboBoxAutoCompleteTextOption.cbactRetainPrefixCase
element.short: Retains the case of characters user has typed. This option has no effect if cbactEndOfLineComplete is not set.

element.name: TComboBoxAutoCompleteTextOption.cbactSearchCaseSensitive
element.short: Search completion string with case sensitivity.

element.name: TComboBoxAutoCompleteTextOption.cbactSearchAscending
element.short: Search completion strings in ascending order, if set. Otherwise search in descending order.

element.name: TComboBoxAutoCompleteText
element.short: Set of TComboBoxAutoCompleteTextOption.

element.name: DefaultComboBoxAutoCompleteText
element.short: Set of [cbactEndOfLineComplete, cbactSearchAscending]

element.name: TComboBoxStyle
element.short: The styles of a combobox.

element.name: TComboBoxStyle.csDropDown
element.short: The box has a drop-down list.

element.name: TComboBoxStyle.csSimple
element.short: The box has a fixed size list.

element.name: TComboBoxStyle.csDropDownList
element.short: The box has a drop-down list, from which entries can be selected (manual text entry disabled).

element.name: TComboBoxStyle.csOwnerDrawFixed
element.short: The drop-down list elements are owner drawn and have a common fixed height.

element.name: TComboBoxStyle.csOwnerDrawVariable
element.short: The drop-down list elements are owner drawn and have an individual height.

element.name: TDrawItemEvent
element.short: The handler type for painting a single item of owner-draw list and combo boxes.

element.name: TDrawItemEvent.Control
element.short: The control to draw.

element.name: TDrawItemEvent.Index
element.short: Index of the item to draw.

element.name: TDrawItemEvent.ARect
element.short: The item rectangle in the Canvas.

element.name: TDrawItemEvent.State
element.short: Flags describing the item state to draw (selected...).

element.name: TMeasureItemEvent
element.short: The handler type for the determination of the Height of a single item in owner-draw list and combo boxes.

element.name: TMeasureItemEvent.Control
element.short: The list or combo box.

element.name: TMeasureItemEvent.Index
element.short: Index of the item to measure.

element.name: TMeasureItemEvent.AHeight
element.short: Here the handler returns the Height of the item (in pixels).

element.name: TCustomComboBox
element.short: The base class for ComboBox components.

descr.p: A ComboBox combines an edit box with an item list. The list can be either static (always visible), or drops down when needed.
Depending on the ComboBox Style the user can type text into the edit box, or he can select items from the Items list.
Despite similarities in appearance to TCustomEdit and TCustomList, the class inherits no properties from these classes (Delphi compatible).
It has some interesting properties including AutoComplete and AutoCompleteText, AutoDropDown and the ability to create and add a History display.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.FReturnArrowState
element.short: Used internally, to return the state of arrow keys from temporary change.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.LMDrawListItem
element.short: Handler for custom drawing items, invokes DrawItem.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.LMMeasureItem
element.short: Determines the height of an item, using MeasureItem in variable owner-draw mode.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.LMSelChange
element.short: Invokes the OnSelect handler.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.CNCommand
element.short: Invokes the OnDropDown or OnCloseUp handlers.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.UpdateSorted
element.short: Handles changes of the Sorted property.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.WMChar
element.short: Prevents ordinary chars from triggering accelerators.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.DoEnter
element.short: Selects the entire text when AutoSelect is True.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.DoExit
element.short: Clears AutoSelect, then calls inherited DoExit

element.name: TCustomComboBox.DrawItem
element.short: Draws an item, using the OnDrawItem handler if one is installed.

descr.p: Software emulation of OnDrawItem event, in OwnerDraw mode.
Calls the OnDrawItem handler, if installed. Otherwise default painting is performed (InternalDrawItem).

element.name: TCustomComboBox.DrawItem.Index
element.short: The item to draw.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.DrawItem.ARect
element.short: The area to paint in the Canvas.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.DrawItem.State
element.short: The state of the item (selected...).

element.name: TCustomComboBox.MeasureItem
element.short: Invokes the OnMeasureItem handler, to get the height of the item in the drop-down list.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.MeasureItem.Index
element.short: The index of the item whose height is required.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.MeasureItem.TheHeight
element.short: The height of the item, in pixels, adjustable by the OnMeasureItem handler.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.LMChanged
element.short: Notification of a change in the edit box.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.Change
element.short: Invokes the OnChange handler, signaling an change in the edit box.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.Select
element.short: Invokes the OnSelect handler.
element.descr: Called whenever the user changes the ItemIndex. For Delphi compatibility ignore when user unselects by changing Text.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.DropDown
element.short: Invokes the OnDropDown handler.
element.descr: Called whenever the list drops down.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.GetItems
element.short: Invokes the OnGetItems handler.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.CloseUp
element.short: Called whenever the list hides.
element.descr: Handles selection in the edit box, also invokes the OnEditingDone and OnCloseUp handlers.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.AdjustDropDown
element.short: Adjusts the extent of the DropDown list.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.GetItemCount
element.short: Returns the number of list items.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.GetItemCount.Result
element.short: The Items.Count.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.RealSetText
element.short: Adjusts ItemIndex according to the new edit box content.

descr.p: If the text AValue occurs in the list of strings, then sets the Itemindex, otherwise does the default action which is to store text as a string rather than performing read-write to a PChar buffer

element.name: TCustomComboBox.RealSetText.AValue
element.short: The new content of the edit box.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.KeyDown
element.short: Filters TAB and RETURN key when used to traverse the list.

descr.p: The inherited method provides software emulation of the event handler OnKeyDown which acts if a key has been pressed and is still down

element.name: TCustomComboBox.KeyDown.Key
element.short: The pressed key.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.KeyDown.Shift
element.short: The state of the modifier keys and mouse buttons.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.KeyUp
element.short: Handles AutoSelect and AutoComplete.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.KeyPress
element.short: Adjusts character case before further processing.

descr.p: The inherited method invokes the OnKeyPress handler, allowing for further input processing.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.UTF8KeyPress
element.short: UTF8KeyPress converts character case if required then calls inherited method

descr.p: The inherited method emulates the pressing of a key, with UTF8 coding. The UTF8 coding should be used where there is the possibility that input/output will occur in any language that requires multiple bytes to represent each character, i.e. all languages except English.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.MouseUp
element.short: AutoSelect when left mouse is clicked for the 1st time after having focus.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.SelectItem
element.short: Selects the item with the given text.
element.descr: When a matching item was found, invokes the OnClick and OnSelect handlers.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.SelectItem.Result
element.short: True when a matching item was found and selected.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.SelectItem.AnItem
element.short: The text to find in Items.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.IntfGetItems
element.short: Called whenever the items can be just-in-time populated.
element.descr: Gets list of items from the interface. Invokes GetItems, which calls the OnGetItems handler.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.AddItem
element.short: Adds an item to the Items list.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.AddItem.Item
element.short: The item text.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.AddItem.AnObject
element.short: The associated object, can be Nil.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.AddHistoryItem
element.short: Add an item as the first entry in History List.

descr.p: When the item is already in the history list, it is moved to the begin of the list.
Otherwise the item is added as the first entry; when the list is full, the last item is removed.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.AddHistoryItem.Item
element.short: The string to be added to the list.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.AddHistoryItem.MaxHistoryCount
element.short: The maximum number of items that can be added to the history.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.AddHistoryItem.SetAsText
element.short: When True the string also is copied into the edit box.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.AddHistoryItem.CaseSensitive
element.short: True means that the list can contain multiple items with the same text, differing in case.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.AddHistoryItem.AnObject
element.short: The object associated with the item; can be Nil.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.Clear
element.short: Removes all items from the list, clears the edit box.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.ClearSelection
element.short: Unselect a possibly selected item (ItemIndex becomes -1).
element.descr: The text selection is not affected. Set SelLength to zero to remove a selection from the text box.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.SelectAll
element.short: Select the entire text in the edit box.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.ArrowKeysTraverseList
element.short: Allows the operator to use also the keyboard Arrow keys to move through the list.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.AutoComplete
element.short: Allows to select items from partial input, of the begin of the item text.
element.descr: The first matching item is selected. The user can continue entering characters, until the desired (or no) matching item is selected.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.AutoCompleteText
element.short: Options for the behavior of the Auto-Complete feature.

ul.li: Enabled: Enable Auto-Completion feature.
EndOfLineComplete: Perform Auto-Complete only when cursor is at the end of the string.
RetainPrefixCase: Retains the case of characters user has typed. (This option has no effect if cbactEndOfLineComplete is False)
SearchCaseSensitive: Search completion string with case sensitivity.
SearchAscending: Search completion string in accending order. (False will search in descending order)

descr.p: This property exists as a Set of Options, so zero or more options may be operational

element.name: TCustomComboBox.AutoDropDown
element.short: Makes the drop-down list appear as soon as the user starts entering text.

descr.p: If False, the drop-down list only appears when the down button to the right of the edit box is clicked.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.AutoSelect
element.short: Selects the entire content of the edit box when the control receives the focus.

descr.p: When True, the edit control will select all its text when:

ul.li: It receives focus
The Enter key is pressed.
A new item is selected.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.AutoSelected
element.short: True indicates that the selection was marked automatically by the control.

descr.p: True indicates that the combobox control has just performed an AutoSelect operation so that subsequent mouse-clicks and keystrokes proceed normally without selecting the text.
False is set when the combobox control loses focus.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.CharCase
element.short: Indicates how text is converted during input (upper, lower, or as entered).

element.name: TCustomComboBox.DroppedDown
element.short: Indicates whether the drop-down list has appeared.
element.descr: Setting this property opens or closes the drop-down list.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.DropDownCount
element.short: The height of the drop-down list, measured in number of items.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.ItemHeight
element.short: The default height of a list item.
element.descr: In owner-draw mode the value can be adjusted by the application, otherwise it is determined by the widget.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.ItemIndex
element.short: The index of the currently selected item, -1 if none is selected.

descr.p: Setting the ItemIndex selects the item in the list.
The first list item has index 0, up to ListCount-1.
If no item is selected, ItemIndex is -1.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.Items
element.short: The list of all items in the control.

descr.p: The Items strings are displayed in the static or drop-down list of the control.
Reading allows to access the contents of the list (TStrings compatible).
Assign another string list to replace the items.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.ItemWidth
element.short: The minimum width of the items in the drop-down list.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.MaxLength
element.short: The maximum length of user input.
element.descr: Set MaxLength to e.g. the fixed length of a string field, where the input is stored later.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.OnChange
element.short: Event handler for user changed text in the edit box.

descr.p: This event covers only changes made by the user, not by code. Note that this differs from how other OnChange events work, for example TEdit.OnChange is triggered by code text changes. This event is also triggered when the selection is changed by using the combo box list.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.OnCloseUp
element.short: Handler invoked when the drop-down list closes.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.OnDrawItem
element.short: Handler for special painting of an item (in owner-draw mode).

element.name: TCustomComboBox.OnDropDown
element.short: Handler invoked when the list has dropped down.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.OnGetItems
element.short: Handler invoked when widgetset items list can be populated

descr.p: Some widgetsets like gtk call this just before the list drops down, while others do it on handle creation. This event allows to handle both cases with one event.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.OnMeasureItem
element.short: Handler invoked when the height of an item is required.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.OnSelect
element.short: Handler invoked when an item is selected.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.ReadOnly
element.short: Disallows entry of free text.
element.descr: When True, only items from the list are accepted, by direct selection from the list or AutoComplete.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.SelLength
element.short: The number of selected UTF-8 characters in the edit box.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.SelStart
element.short: The zero-based index of the begin of the selection in the edit box.

descr.p: If text is selected, this is the starting position, otherwise the cursor position.
When no text is selected, SelStart is the cursor position, and SelLength=0.
Writing moves the cursor, and removes the selection. Set SelLength after changing SelStart, to establish a new selection.
SelStart is a zero-based index into Text, in contrast to usual 1-based string indices.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.SelText
element.short: The selected text in the edit box.
element.descr: Assign an new string to replace the selected text.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.Sorted
element.short: Determines whether the list entries are sorted.
element.descr: Setting this property to True enforces ascending alphanumeric case-insensitive sorting of the list. When True, new entries are added in sort order, not to the end of the list.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.Style
element.short: Appearance and behaviour of the ComboBox (static/drop-down, owner-draw...).

descr.p: The Style is quite Windows centric, reflecting the evolution of ComboBox styles.
Basic styles are

ul.li: csSimple: edit box with a static list (no drop-down).
csDropDown: edit box with a drop-down list.
csDropDownList: strings can not be entered by the user, only selected from the drop-down list.

descr.p: Later owner-drawn drop-down lists have been added, with

ul.li: csOwnerDrawFixed: all items in the drop-down list have the same height.
csOwnerDrawVariable: every item can have a different height.

descr.p: The ReadOnly property affects the edit box behaviour even in the owner-draw styles.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.Text
element.short: The string appearing in the edit box.

descr.p: Setting Text selects a possibly matching item in the list.
If an item is selected from the list, it replaces the contents of Text.
Free user input can be disallowed by the ReadOnly property, so that only strings from the list can be selected.
Text completion can be established by the AutoComplete property.

element.name: TComboBox
element.short: A combination of an edit box and a (drop-down) list allowing one of several options to be chosen.

descr.p: The Text property reflects the text entered into the edit box, or selected from the list.
The selectable values are kept in the Items list. Clicking on the ellipsis (...), next to Items in the Object Inspector, opens an editor which allows the designer to populate the Items list.
At run-time, the entry selected from the list replaces the text in the edit box, and ItemIndex holds the (zero-based) index number of the selected item.
If no value is selected from the drop-down list, the default text (if any) remains, or any information typed directly into Text will be returned, and ItemIndex takes the value of -1

element.name: TListBoxStyle
element.short: Determines how items are drawn in a ListBox.

element.name: TListBoxStyle.lbStandard
element.short: Items drawn by the widget.

element.name: TListBoxStyle.lbOwnerDrawFixed
element.short: Items drawn by user code, all items have the same height.

element.name: TListBoxStyle.lbOwnerDrawVariable
element.short: Items drawn by user code, every item can have a different height.

element.name: TSelectionChangeEvent
element.short: Handler type for change notifications from a ListBox.

element.name: TSelectionChangeEvent.Sender
element.short: The ListBox control.

element.name: TSelectionChangeEvent.User
element.short: True if the user changed the selection, False if changed by code.

element.name: TCustomListBox
element.short: The base class for TListBox.

element.name: TCustomListBox.AssignItemDataToCache
element.short: Copy selection state into the cache.

element.name: TCustomListBox.AssignCacheToItemData
element.short: Sends the cached selection state to the widget.

element.name: TCustomListBox.CalculateStandardItemHeight
element.short: Determine the standard Height of the items, when no widget has yet been created.

element.name: TCustomListBox.Loaded
element.short: Sends the predefined ItemIndex to the widget.

element.name: TCustomListBox.InitializeWnd
element.short: Copies the Items into the widget.

element.name: TCustomListBox.FinalizeWnd
element.short: Caches the Items stored in the widget.

element.name: TCustomListBox.CheckIndex
element.short: Assures that the index is inside the Items list bounds.
element.errors: Raises an IndexOutOfBounds exception when the index is out of bounds.

element.name: TCustomListBox.GetSelected.Result
element.short: The selection state of the item.

element.name: TCustomListBox.GetCachedDataSize
element.short: Returns the size of a cached item.

element.name: TCustomListBox.GetCachedData
element.short: Returns an pointer to the cached item data.
element.errors: Raises an InvalidOperation exception when the cache is invalid, i.e. when the widget has been created.

element.name: TCustomListBox.DrawItem
element.short: Paints an item in owner-draw mode.

element.name: TCustomListBox.DoSelectionChange
element.short: Invokes the OnSelectionChange handler.

element.name: TCustomListBox.SendItemIndex
element.short: Sends the ItemIndex to the widget.

element.name: TCustomListBox.AddItem
element.short: Adds an item to the list.

element.name: TCustomListBox.AddItem.Item
element.short: The item text.

element.name: TCustomListBox.AddItem.AnObject
element.short: The associated object, can be Nil.

element.name: TCustomListBox.Clear
element.short: Removes all items from the list.

element.name: TCustomListBox.ClearSelection
element.short: Unselects all items.

element.name: TCustomListBox.GetIndexAtXY
element.short: Find the item at the given client coordinates.

element.name: TCustomListBox.GetIndexAtXY.Result
element.short: The item index, -1 if no item could be found.

element.name: TCustomListBox.GetIndexAtXY.X
element.short: The X client coordinate.

element.name: TCustomListBox.GetIndexAtXY.Y
element.short: The Y client coordinate.

element.name: TCustomListBox.GetIndexAtY.Result
element.short: The item index, -1 if no item could be found.

element.name: TCustomListBox.GetIndexAtY.Y
element.short: The Y client coordinate.

element.name: TCustomListBox.GetSelectedText
element.short: Get the text of all selected items in one string.

element.name: TCustomListBox.GetSelectedText.Result
element.short: The item strings, one per line.

element.name: TCustomListBox.ItemAtPos
element.short: Get the item index for the given client coordinates.

element.name: TCustomListBox.ItemAtPos.Result
element.short: The calculated item index, can be out of the Items bounds.

element.name: TCustomListBox.ItemAtPos.Pos
element.short: The item position.

element.name: TCustomListBox.ItemAtPos.Existing
element.short: True when the index is requested for insertion of a new item.

element.name: TCustomListBox.ItemRect
element.short: Returns the client area of an item (including scrolling).
element.descr: Only an index from 0 to ItemCount is considered valid, i.e. the result is valid also for the next item, that will be added subsequently.

element.name: TCustomListBox.ItemRect.Result
element.short: The item area; all zeroes for an invalid item index.

element.name: TCustomListBox.ItemRect.Index
element.short: The tentative item index.

element.name: TCustomListBox.ItemVisible
element.short: Returns True if the item is at least partially visible in the scrolled list.

element.name: TCustomListBox.ItemFullyVisible
element.short: Returns True if the item is fully visible in the scrolled list.

element.name: TCustomListBox.LockSelectionChange
element.short: Blocks selection changes during update of the widget.

element.name: TCustomListBox.MakeCurrentVisible
element.short: Makes the item at ItemIndex visible, possibly scrolling the list.

element.name: TCustomListBox.MeasureItem
element.short: Request the Height of a list item, using the OnMeasureItem handler.

element.name: TCustomListBox.MeasureItem.Index
element.short: The item index.

element.name: TCustomListBox.MeasureItem.TheHeight
element.short: The height of the item in pixels, can be changed by the handler.

element.name: TCustomListBox.SelectAll
element.short: Selects all items in the list (in ExtendedSelect mode).

element.name: TCustomListBox.UnlockSelectionChange
element.short: Unlocks previously locked selection changes.

element.name: TCustomListBox.ClickOnSelChange
element.short: Allows selection changes to generate a Click event.
element.descr: Delphi generates an OnClick event when the selection changes. The LCL adds a more specific OnSelectionChange event. Set ClickOnSelChange to False, when selection changes should be handled only in OnSelectionChange, and should not generate an OnClick event (Delphi compatible).

element.name: TCustomListBox.Columns
element.short: The number of visible vertical columns.

descr.p: A ListBox can have multiple columns, not only multiple rows.
When Columns is greater than zero, it specifies the number of columns that are visible without horizontal scrolling. I.e. the width of a single column becomes Width/Columns.

element.name: TCustomListBox.Count
element.short: The number of items in the list.

element.name: TCustomListBox.ExtendedSelect
element.short: True when a contiguous range of items can be selected by a SHIFT-click. Default True.

descr.p: Normally a click into the list selects one item, and deselects all other items.
When MultiSelect is True, the user can select/deselect further items with CTRL-click.
When ExtendedSelect also is True, the user can SHIFT-click on an item, to select all items between this and the last selected item.

element.name: TCustomListBox.IntegralHeight
element.short: Not implemented: shrink the Height of the widget, so that it only shows fully visible rows.

element.name: TCustomListBox.ItemHeight
element.short: The default height of all items.

element.name: TCustomListBox.ItemIndex
element.short: The currently selected item, -1 if none.
element.descr: If MultiSelect is True, ItemIndex represents the selected item which also has the focus.

element.name: TCustomListBox.Items
element.short: The list of all items in the control.

descr.p: Reading allows to access the contents of the list (TStrings compatible).
Assign another string list to replace the items.

element.name: TCustomListBox.MultiSelect
element.short: Allows to select more than one Item from the list, using CTRL-click.

element.name: TCustomListBox.OnDrawItem
element.short: Handler for special painting of an item (in owner-draw mode).

element.name: TCustomListBox.OnMeasureItem
element.short: Handler invoked when the height of an item is required.

element.name: TCustomListBox.OnSelectionChange
element.short: Handler invoked when an item is selected.

element.name: TCustomListBox.ScrollWidth
element.short: The virtual width of the ListBox, in pixels.
element.descr: This property determines, how far the listbox can be scrolled horizontally. In a multi-column ListBox it also determines the total number of vertical columns, together with Columns.

element.name: TCustomListBox.SelCount
element.short: The number of selected iems in the list.

element.name: TCustomListBox.Selected
element.short: Get or set the Selected state of an item.

element.name: TCustomListBox.Sorted
element.short: Determines whether the list entries are sorted.
element.descr: Setting this property to True enforces ascending alphanumeric case-insensitive sorting of the list. When True, new entries are added in sort order, not to the end of the list.

element.name: TCustomListBox.Style
element.short: Appearance of the ListBox - normal, owner-draw fixed, or owner-draw variable.

element.name: TCustomListBox.TopIndex
element.short: Index of the first visible (topmost) item.

element.name: TListBox
element.short: A scrollable list of strings.

descr.p: The strings are stored in the Items list.

At design time a click on the ellipsis (...) next to the Items entry in the Object Inspector opens an string-list editor, in which the individual text-strings for the list items can be entered or edited. The editor also allows the entries to be sorted alphabetically in normal or reverse order.

element.name: TCustomEdit
element.short: The base class for controls presenting editable text.

descr.p: This class implements various visual attributes of the control and its contained text, as well as simple editing and clipboard operations.
Text attributes (bold, italic...) are not supported.

element.name: TCustomEdit.DoEnter
element.short: Invokes the OnEnter handler, then selects the entire text when AutoSelect is True.
element.descr: This special handling is required when the control is entered by keystrokes, not by a mouse click.

element.name: TCustomEdit.GetSelLength.Result
element.short: The number of selected UTF-8 characters.

element.name: TCustomEdit.WMChar
element.short: Prevents keystrokes from acting as accelerators.

element.name: TCustomEdit.MouseUp
element.short: Selects the entire text when AutoSelect is True.

element.name: TCustomEdit.Clear
element.short: Deletes all text.

element.name: TCustomEdit.SelectAll
element.short: Selects the entire text in the control.

element.name: TCustomEdit.ClearSelection
element.short: Deletes (removes) the selected text.

element.name: TCustomEdit.CopyToClipboard
element.short: Copies the selected text into the clipboard.

element.name: TCustomEdit.CutToClipboard
element.short: Moves the selected text into the clipboard (removes it from the control).

element.name: TCustomEdit.PasteFromClipboard
element.short: Inserts text from the clipboard at the current position, possibly replacing the selected text.

element.name: TCustomEdit.Undo
element.short: Reverts the last edit action.

element.name: TCustomEdit.Alignment
element.short: The horizontal adjustment of the text - left, right, or centered.

element.name: TCustomEdit.AutoSelect
element.short: If True, the edit control will select all its text when it receives focus or when the Enter key is pressed.

element.name: TCustomEdit.AutoSelected
element.short: True when the text selection was established automatically.

element.name: TCustomEdit.AutoSize
element.short: Allows to adjust the control to the extent of the contained text.

element.name: TCustomEdit.CanUndo
element.short: Indicates whether recent changes can be reverted.

element.name: TCustomEdit.CaretPos
element.short: The position of the text cursor.

descr.p: Character positions are relative to the string, independent of LTR/RTL display. The position reflects logical (UTF-8) characters.
Position zero is right before the first character.
If there is a selection, the caret is considered to be right after the last selected character.

element.name: TCustomEdit.CharCase
element.short: Allows to force the text into all upper or lower case.

descr.p: The following conversions can be specified:

ul.li: Unchanged
All upper case letters
All lower case letters

descr.remark: According conversions apply to the entire text, and can not be reverted.

element.name: TCustomEdit.EchoMode
element.short: Allows to modify the text display, useful for entering passwords.

descr.p: The following conversions can be specified:

ul.li: emNormal: Unchanged
emNone: All spaces
emPassword: All PasswordChars

descr.remark: According conversions apply to the entire text, and can not be reverted.

element.name: TCustomEdit.HideSelection
element.short: Allows to hide the selection, when the control doesn't have the focus.

element.name: TCustomEdit.MaxLength
element.short: The maximum length of the text; zero for unlimited.
element.descr: In Delphi MaxLength only limits user input. The LCL instead restricts the maximum length of the contained text; this simplifies the implementation for non-Win32 widgetsets.

element.name: TCustomEdit.Modified
element.short: True when the text has changed [how?].
element.descr: Reset whenever the changed text was stored (saved) by code.

element.name: TCustomEdit.OnChange
element.short: Event handler for any change in text.
element.descr: Text changes which trigger OnChange include changing the text programatically and also changing it by the user, for example using the keyboard or a virtual keyboard. Note that some OnChange events in other classes might not be trigerred on programatical changes, for example TComboBox.OnChange. This event should not happen when only starting up a form, without any extra code.

element.name: TCustomEdit.PasswordChar
element.short: Allows to obfuscate the displayed text, showing all characters as PasswordChar.

descr.p: Typically used in password input, to hide the input from other viewers.
descr.remark: Malware still can read the Text property (WM_GETTEXT), to get the real text.

element.name: TCustomEdit.ReadOnly
element.short: Prevents the user from changing the text.

element.name: TCustomEdit.SelLength
element.short: The number of currently selected characters.

element.name: TCustomEdit.SelStart
element.short: The zero-based index of the first character in the selection.

element.name: TCustomEdit.SelText
element.short: The selected text in the edit box.
element.descr: Assign an new string to replace the selected text.

element.name: TCustomEdit.Text
element.short: The text in the edit box.

element.name: TMemoScrollbar
element.short: A ScrollBar for use in Memo Boxes.
element.descr: Scroll Bar specifically for use in Memo Boxes. Inherits most of its properties from its ancestor, TControlScrollBar

element.name: TCustomMemo
element.short: The base class for multi-line text controls.

descr.p: The text in a multi-line control can be accessed in two ways:

ul.li: Lines allows access to every single line.
Lines.Text represents the entire text as one string.

descr.p: The overhead involved with every property depends on the internal representation representation of the text, in the widget. In either case multiple changes to the Text property should be done in a local copy, written back after all changes have been applied.
The logical lines (paragraphs) in Lines do not always match the displayed lines. When WordWrap is True, every paragraph can wrap into multiple display lines. [really?]

element.name: TCustomMemo.RealGetText
element.short: Returns the contents of Lines.Text, separated by [NewLine?].

element.name: TCustomMemo.RealGetText.Result
element.short: The entire text in one string.

element.name: TCustomMemo.RealSetText
element.short: Replaces Lines.Text.

element.name: TCustomMemo.RealSetText.Value
element.short: The entire text in one string. Lines are separated by LineFeed (LF) and/or CarriageReturn (CR) characters.

element.name: TCustomMemo.GetCachedText.Result
element.short: Always False, a cache is not implemented.

element.name: TCustomMemo.GetCachedText.CachedText
element.short: The CachedText of type TCaption that is being fetched

element.name: TCustomMemo.GetCaretPos.Result
element.short: Returns the position of the cursor marker or caret

element.name: TCustomMemo.GetControlClassDefaultSize.Result
element.short: Returns the default size, stored as a TPoint

element.name: TCustomMemo.Append
element.short: Appends a line to the text.

element.name: TCustomMemo.Append.Value
element.short: The text in the line.

element.name: TCustomMemo.Lines
element.short: An array with one string for every line (paragraph) in the control.

element.name: TCustomMemo.HorzScrollBar
element.short: The horizontal scroll bar for this control.

element.name: TCustomMemo.VertScrollBar
element.short: The vertical scroll bar for this control.

element.name: TCustomMemo.ScrollBars
element.short: Adds vertical and/or horizontal scrollbars to the control.

element.name: TCustomMemo.WantReturns
element.short: Allows the user to insert Return characters (line breaks) into the text.

descr.p: The Enter key typically is used to press the default button in a form, so that it cannot be used to add line breaks into the text.
Setting WantReturns to True allows to enter line breaks, when the control has the focus.
Even if WantReturns is False, CTRL-Enter inserts an line break.

element.name: TCustomMemo.WantTabs
element.short: Allows to enter Tab characters into the text.

descr.p: The Tab key is normally used to move the focus to the next control, so that it cannot be used to add Tabs to the text.
When WantTabs is True, the Tab key inserts a Tab character into the text, instead of moving the focus to then next control.
Even if WantTabs is True, the user can Tab into the control, but not out again.

element.name: TCustomMemo.WordWrap
element.short: Allows long logical lines (paragraphs) to wrap into multiple display lines.
element.descr: When False, long lines are truncated at the right margin of the control, unless the text can be scrolled horizontally.

element.name: TEdit
element.short: A control with a single line of editable text.

element.name: TMemo
element.short: Control for editable multi-line text.

descr.p: The textual data is held as an array of strings in Lines, where it can be edited

element.name: TStaticBorderStyle
element.short: The border style of static text controls.

element.name: TStaticBorderStyle.sbsNone
element.short: No border.

element.name: TStaticBorderStyle.sbsSingle
element.short: Single line border.

element.name: TStaticBorderStyle.sbsSunken
element.short: Sunken 3-D border.

element.name: TCustomStaticText
element.short: The base class for TStaticText.

element.name: TCustomStaticText.WMActivate
element.short: Defers the focus to FocusControl.

element.name: TCustomStaticText.GetLabelText
element.short: Returns the Caption of the control.

element.name: TCustomStaticText.GetLabelText.Result
element.short: The Caption text.

element.name: TCustomStaticText.Alignment
element.short: The horizontal adjustment of the text - centered, left- or right-justified.

element.name: TCustomStaticText.BorderStyle
element.short: The border shown around the control.

element.name: TCustomStaticText.FocusControl
element.short: The control that shall receive the focus instead of this control.

element.name: TCustomStaticText.ShowAccelChar
element.short: Makes the accelerator character stand out (underlined) of the displayed text.

element.name: TCustomStaticText.Transparent
element.short: Makes the control either opaque or transparent.

element.name: TStaticText
element.short: Control to display an constant text.

descr.p: This control can be used instead of TLabel, when a TWinControl is required.

element.name: TStaticText.Caption
element.short: The text to show.

element.name: TButtonControl
element.short: The base class for various button controls.

element.name: TButtonControl.DoOnChange
element.short: Invokes the OnChange handler.

element.name: TButtonControl.Checked
element.short: The state of the check mark. Here always False, can be implemented in derived classes.

element.name: TButtonControl.ClicksDisabled
element.short: Allows to disable clicks, without showing the button as disabled.

element.name: TButtonControl.OnChange
element.short: Handler for any [which?] change in properties of the control.

element.name: TButtonActionLink
element.short: Links an button to an action.

element.name: TButtonActionLink.FClientButton
element.short: The button to which this action applies.

element.name: TButtonActionLink.AssignClient
element.short: Installs the client button.

element.name: TButtonActionLink.SetChecked
element.short: Sets the Checked property of the linked button.

element.name: TButtonActionLinkClass
element.short: class of TButtonActionLink

element.name: TCustomButton
element.short: The base class for clickable buttons (TButton and TBitBtn).

element.name: TCustomButton.UpdateFocus
element.short: Notifies Parent of focus changes.

element.name: TCustomButton.Click
element.short: Propagates ModalResult to the parent form, before further processing.

element.name: TCustomButton.WSSetDefault
element.short: Notify the widget of dynamic changes of the Default property.

element.name: TCustomButton.WSSetText
element.short: Notify the widgetset of changes in the Caption and/or accelerator.

element.name: TCustomButton.UpdateDefaultCancel
element.short: Update the parent form's Default and Cancel properties.

element.name: TCustomButton.ExecuteDefaultAction
element.short: Invoke Click if the control is Active or Default.

element.name: TCustomButton.ExecuteCancelAction
element.short: Invoke Click if the control is the Cancel button.

element.name: TCustomButton.Active
element.short: True if this control is the Cancel or Default button.

element.name: TCustomButton.Cancel
element.short: True if this is the modal Cancel button.

descr.p: Pressing ESC in a modal form is equivalent to pressing the Cancel button.

element.name: TCustomButton.Default
element.short: True if this is the modal Default button.

descr.p: Pressing ENTER in a modal form is equivalent to pressing the Default button.

element.name: TCustomButton.ModalResult
element.short: When clicked, the button will close the form and return its ModalResult. (unless mrNone)

element.name: TButton
element.short: A push button control.

element.name: TCheckBoxState
element.short: The states of a checkbox - Unchecked, Checked or Greyed.

element.name: TCheckBoxState.cbUnchecked
element.descr: The check box has no check mark, indicating that the item is not selected.

element.name: TCheckBoxState.cbChecked
element.descr: The check box has a check mark in it, indicating that the item is selected.

element.name: TCheckBoxState.cbGrayed
element.descr: The check box state cannot be changed by the user.

element.name: TCustomCheckBox
element.short: The base class for checkbox components.

descr.p: Check boxes present the user with options that can be selected (checked) or deselected (unchecked).

element.name: TCustomCheckBox.DoChange
element.short: Invokes either the OnClick or OnChange handler.

element.name: TCustomCheckBox.Click
element.descr: Overridden to do nothing.

element.name: TCustomCheckBox.DoClickOnChange
element.short: Invokes either the OnClick or OnChange handler.

element.name: TCustomCheckBox.RetrieveState
element.short: Retrieves the checkbox state from the widget.

element.name: TCustomCheckBox.Toggle
element.short: Alternate between checked and unchecked state.
element.descr: [What about disabled state?]

element.name: TCustomCheckBox.ApplyChanges
element.short: Asks the widget to update the visual appearance of the object.

element.name: TCustomCheckBox.AllowGrayed
element.short: Allows the check box to be in a "grayed" state.

descr.p: If AllowGrayed is set to True, the check box has three possible states: checked, unchecked and grayed. If AllowGrayed is set to False, the check box has only two possible states: checked and unchecked.

element.name: TCustomCheckBox.State
element.short: Indicates whether the check box is checked (selected), unchecked (deselected) or grayed (disabled).

descr.p: See TCheckBoxState for possible values of State.

element.name: TCheckBox
element.short: A label with a box which can contain a check mark.

element.name: TToggleBox
element.short: A labelled box capable of being checked or unchecked[???]

descr.p: The Application Programmer is responsible for ensuring that the OnClick event handler recognises the State of the box, takes the appropriate Action and places the State into the next appropriate value

element.name: TRadioButton
element.short: A selection button that works with other Radio Buttons in a mutually exclusive way - if one button is selected, none of the others in the group can be selected.

descr.p: The Application Programmer is responsible for ensuring that the OnClick event handler for each button has a unique Action, and that the Actions of the other (deselected and therefore inactive) buttons are turned off.
TRadioGroup behaves differently from a group of TRadioButton controls placed arbitrarily around a form.

In the case of TRadioButton, the mutual exclusivity is a feature that applies to any RadioButton anywhere in the Form, and the RadioButtons can be rearranged in any order or placed anywhere within the containing Form, while in TRadioGroup the exclusivity applies only to buttons within the Group, which are ordered strictly according to their ItemIndex within the Items stringlist.

TRadioButton is an entity in itself, with a number of additional properties, whereas the buttons within TRadioGroup are not separate entities, but rather are simply entries in a list of strings, each of which is associated with the on-screen image of a RadioButton.
The example shows the difference between the use of TRadioButton and TRadioGroup

element.name: TCustomLabel
element.short: The base class for TLabel.

element.name: TCustomLabel.CanTab
element.short: Always False, as you can't tab to a label.

element.name: TCustomLabel.DoMeasureTextPosition
element.short: Determines the origin of the text, within the control.

element.name: TCustomLabel.HasMultiLine
element.short: Searches for newline characters in the text.

element.name: TCustomLabel.CalculateSize
element.short: Determines the text extent, base on a maximum field width.

element.name: TCustomLabel.CalculateSize.MaxWidth
element.short: Where wordwrap may start.

element.name: TCustomLabel.WMActivate
element.short: Defers the focus to the FocusControl.

element.name: TCustomLabel.GetLabelText
element.short: Returns the Caption string.

element.name: TCustomLabel.UpdateSize
element.short: Handles OptimalFill.

element.name: TCustomLabel.CalcFittingFontHeight
element.short: Calculate the maximum height of the font needed to fit the available space, given the MaxWidth and MaxHeight constraints

element.name: TCustomLabel.AdjustFontForOptimalFill
element.short: If True, attempts to adjust font for an optimal fill of the space available.

element.name: TCustomLabel.Alignment
element.short: Horizontal text justification (centered, left- or right-justified).

element.name: TCustomLabel.FocusControl
element.short: The control associated with the label and its accelerator key (AccelChar).

descr.p: Set FocusControl to the control that shall receive the focus, when the label's accelerator key is pressed.

A label control cannot receive the focus (it's read-only), but can display an accelerator key indicator, just as menu entries can do.
A windowed control (Edit...) can receive focus, but cannot indicate an accelerator key.

Using a combination of both an label and another control allows to specify both the accelerator key, in the label's caption, and make the other control receive the focus when the user presses that accelerator key.

An accelerator key is marked by an ampersand '&' in the label's caption, immediately preceding the character to be used as the accelerator key. The marked character appears underlined on screen, when ShowAccelChar=True.

E.g. when you have a NameEdit1 control on a form, preceded by a label NameLabel1, you can set NameLabel1.FocusControl to NameEdit1, and NameLabel1.Caption to '&Name'. This makes the NameLabel1 displayed as 'Name'.

element.name: TCustomLabel.Layout
element.short: Vertical alignment of the text (at top, bottom or centered).

element.name: TCustomLabel.OptimalFill
element.short: If True, the font size is adjusted for optimal fill of the available space.

element.name: TCustomLabel.ShowAccelChar
element.short: Underlines the character in the label that acts as an accelerator with a shortcut key.

descr.p: When False, ampersands '&' in the label's caption are displayed as ordinary characters (as in the Object Inspector).
When True, the character following the ampersand appears underlined, and when the user presses the accelerator key (CTRL+character), the text cursor jumps to the associated FocusControl.

element.name: TCustomLabel.Transparent
element.short: Whether the viewer can see through the control. Default True [Delphi: False?]

descr.p: Opaque Labels have their enclosing rectangle filled with the background color of the label. This can be the color of the Parent control, when ParentColor is True.
Setting Transparent to True makes the label transparent, not hiding any background details.
When a label is put onto a graphics control, setting Transparent to False makes the label stand out, while Transparent=True doesn't obscure so much of the graphic.

element.name: TCustomLabel.WordWrap
element.short: Allows text to wrap into multiple lines, when the text is too long for the available Width.

descr.p: When False, the text is truncated at the right margin of the control.
WordWrap=true and AutoSize=true requires that the Width is fixed, e.g. by anchoring the left and right side.

element.name: TLabel
element.short: Control to show static text, possibly in multiple lines.

element.name: Register
element.short: Registers the components declared in this unit.

topic.name: HowToUseStdCtrls
topic.short: How to use StdCtrls, ComCtrls or ExtCtrls

descr.p: The Units StdCtrls, ComCtrls and ExtCtrls contain definitions and descriptions of many of the most commonly used controls for constructing Forms and other objects in Lazarus GUI applications.

Most controls are split into a final class, such as TButton, TMemo, TScrollBar etc., and a corresponding ancestor class such as TCustomButton, TCustomMemo or TCustomScrollBar. The final class is designed for immediate use, it almost only publishes the properties of the control. The corresponding custom ancestor class (TCustomXXX) can be used to derive controls with special (customized) appearance or behaviour.

If you drop a component from the component palette on the form editor you don't need to add code explicitly to create it. The component is automatically created by the IDE together with the form, and destroyed when the form is destroyed.

However, if you create the component yourself by code, and don't specify an Owner for it (Create(Nil)), you are responsible for freeing the component when it is no longer needed. You better construct it with Create(Self), where Self means the containing Form or Parent control.

A control also must have a Parent control, maybe the Form, so that it can become visible within the client area of its Parent. The Top and Left properties specify the placement of the control within its Parent. The Object Tree reflects the Parent-Client relationships of all controls on the form.
Unlike controls, mere components are invisible at runtime (Open Dialogs...). Controls can be made invisible at runtime as well, by setting their Visible property to False.

If you place a component on the Form Designer and look at the Object Inspector, you can observe the Top and Left properties change as you move the component around. The same for the Width and Height properties, when you resize a control by dragging it's size grips.
When you modify the properties in the Object Inspector, the control on the form will reflect the changes as well.
You can also explicitly change the properties of the object in code by typing (in the appropriate Implementation section of the Source editor), for example
In summary, there are usually about three different ways to determine each property of a component:

ul.li: by using the mouse,
by setting the values in the Object Inspector,
or explicitly by writing code.

descr.p: The components defined in these Units have several properties that are common to most of them, and other properties that are specific to the individual components. We shall describe the most common ones here. Unusual or control-specific properties will be described for the individual controls.

Additional Help can always be obtained by selecting a property or keyword, in either the Object Inspector or the Source Editor, and pressing F1. You will be taken by your Help browser to the appropriate page in the documentation.

If the description of a property on that page is insufficient, you can navigate to the corresponding description in the ancestor classes, by selecting the links in the Inheritance listing or by selecting the ancestor Type in the declaration of the object.

tr.td: Use Action when e.g. a button and a menu entry shall perform the same task, e.g. the Close action.

Defines how a control is lined up within its parent control. Possible values are alTop, alBottom (stacked at the top or bottom, using the full available width), alLeft, alRight (placed at the left or right, using the full available height), alNone (place anywhere on parent control) or alClient (takes all available space left over by other controls).

Used to keep a control at a fixed distance from the edges of its Parent control, when the Parent is resized. For example [akBottom, akRight] will keep the control a fixed distance from the bottom right corner. Anchoring both [akLeft, akRight] will make the control extend or shrink in Width, together with its Parent.
When True, a text control will select all its text when it receives focus or when the Enter key is pressed.
True indicate that the edit or combobox control has performed an AutoSelect operation, so that subsequent mouse-clicks and keystrokes proceed normally without selecting the text.[~remove this?]
The space around the edge between an [Anchored???] control and its siblings [parent?].

The text that is displayed on the control; it should preferably give some clue as to the function of the control, or an instruction such as 'Close' or 'Execute'. By default Caption is set to be the same as the 'Name' property, and the application designer should substitute meaningful text instead of the default values.
Indicates how text is displayed in a text editing control: Normal (retaining the case of the letters typed by the user), converted to uppercase, or converted to lowercase

Sets the minimum and maximum sizes for a control. If a control is resized the new dimensions are always within the ranges given here. You should take care when setting these options that they do not conflict with the Anchors and Align settings.
The Color to be used to draw the control's background [or to write the text it contains -> Font.Color!???].
Determines whether a control can be selected or perform an action. If it is not Enabled, it is often Grayed out on the Form.

The Font to be used for writing the text associated with the control - either the caption or label, or the text-strings contained within the control. The entry on the Object Inspector usually has a (+) box on the left, and selecting this box reveals further options such as character set, color and size.
A short informative pop-up text that appears when the mouse-cursor moves over the control.
The list of 'Things' that the object contains, such as a group of images, a series of lines of text, a number of actions in an actionlist, etc
An array of strings, containing the paragraph texts in Memo controls. The array index is zero-based, ie the lines are numbered [0..numLines-1]

The identifier by which the control is known in the program. The IDE gives it a default name based on the underlying type, for example successive instances of TBitButton would be named Form1.BitBitton1 and Form1.BitButton2; it is up to the application programmer to give them more meaningful names such as ExitButton or OKButton. By default the Name of the control is applied to the Caption for the control, but the text of the Caption may be changed separately.
A window containing context-sensitive menu entries, that pops up when the right mouse button is clicked on the object.
Determines where the control is located on the parent form or control.
If True, the user cannot change the text in the control.
Allows to enable or suppress Hints.
The options available for Style depend upon the sort of Control being considered: for instance the Style may be defined by TFormStyle, TBorderStyle, TButtonStyle etc.
Specifies the sequence of controls, that are entered when the user presses the Tab key.
Specifies whether the control can be reached (or is skipped) by pressing the Tab key.

Like Caption, the user editable text that appears in the control. Applies particularly to Edit, Memo and ComboBox types of controls. Most of the editing operations (such as Select, Clear, Cut, Copy) are performed in this property. If the control contains more than a single line of text, then the textual elements are arranged as a zero-based array of strings in Lines (TMemo) or Items (TListBox, TComboBox).
If true, the control can be seen on the Form; if False, it is hidden.
Allows to wrap the Text into multiple lines. When False, the text is clipped at the right margin of the control, but it still can be inspected by moving the caret within the text.

descr.p: The 'Events' tab in the Object Inspector contains a list with events, which can occur for this control. If you select an entry in the list, a ComboBox appears with a DropDown list showing any event handlers that have aleady been defined, and allowing you to choose one for this event. Alternatively you can select the ellipsis (three dots ...) and you will be taken to the Source Editor, where the Object Inspector created an new event handler method for you. You also can type the name of your handler in the Object Inspector and press Enter, to create a new handler method.

While a large number of events is available for any given control, in practice it is only necessary to populate a few of them. For most controls, it is sufficient to provide coding for 'OnClick'; for more complex controls it may be necessary also to provide for 'OnEntry' (when the control receives the focus) and 'OnExit' (when the control looses the focus); or you may need to write an event handler for 'OnChange' or 'OnScroll', depending on the nature of the particular control with which you are dealing.

Many controls have a default event, usually OnClick, for which an handler is created with a double click on the control. Or right click on the control, and select the first entry: 'Create default event'.

A common strategy in Object-Oriented programming is to provide an ActionList with the facility for entering, removing or editing a number of pre-defined actions, from which the most appropriate can be selected to use in any particular instance [of?].

tr.td: Action to be taken if any change is detected (e.g. by mouse click, key press, edit text, etc)

Action to be taken when the (left) mouse button is clicked. This is usually the main or default action of the control; for example clicking on a button or checkbox initiates the action associated with the checkbox. It may alternatively initate a process of selection, for instance in a TextBox or Memo.

A method to emulate in code the effect of clicking on a control. This method is most often found in Button-type controls (TButton, TBitBtn, TSpeedButton etc). A procedure can be written that calls the same code as the OnClick action. This facility can be particularly useful if the activation of one control by clicking causes a cascade of other controls to be activated, and the Click method can be used to initiate the action rather than having the user explicitly click on a lot of controls.
Action to be taken when a dragged control has been dropped onto this control. [OnDragOver?]
Action to be taken when the control receives the focus. This might include changes in the appearance of the object such as highlighting or raising the border.

Action to be taken when control is about to loose the focus. This is the right place for validity checks of user input, with a chance to disallow moving to a different control when the input is invalid.
Action to be taken on an entered character. Checks...
Action to be taken if a key is down while focus is in this control. This allows to filter or process control characters in a special way.
Action to be taken if a key goes up. This event occurs only once, while auto-repeated keystrokes trigger multiple OnKeyDown or OnKeyPress events.
Action to be taken if the mouse cursor moves over the control. This event fires with every small move, while OnMouseEnter and OnMouseLeave occur only when the mouse enters or leaves the control.
Action to be taken when a mouse button is pressed over the control.
Action to be taken if a mouse button goes up over the control.
Action to be taken when the control is resized. Might include re-alignment of text or selection of a different font size etc. Do not mix up with AutoSize, or you ask for trouble!

descr.p: Constructors such as Create allocate memory and system resources needed by the object. They also call the constructor of any sub-objects present in the class.

Destructors: remove the object and de-allocate memory and other resources. If you call Destroy for an object which hasn't being initialized yet it will generate an error. Always use the Free method to deallocate objects, because it checks whether an object's value is nil before invoking Destroy.
Take the following precautions when creating your own Destroy method:

ul.li: Declare Destroy with the override directive, because it is a virtual method.
Always call 'inherited Destroy;' as the last thing on the destructor code.

Be aware that an exception may be raised on the constructor in case there is not enough memory to create an object, or something else goes wrong. If the exception is not handled inside the constructor, the object will destroyed immediately. In this case Destroy will be called with a partially initialized object, so your destructor must check if the resources were really allocated before disposing of them.
Remember to call Free for all objects created on the constructor.
